analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi

original: 22.18. Vipākattika, Hetuduka🔽Navipākaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Navipākaṁ
analyzed: vipākattika hetuduka  na vipākam na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na vipāka
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the method of the Triads🔽Resultant, cause dyad🔽With a resultant, non-cause condition …

original: nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipākadhammadhammo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Navipākaṁ
analyzed: na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na vipāka

original: nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Navipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Navipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetu
analyzed: na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetum dhammam paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetu
translated: With a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-producing, non-cause condition …🔽With a resultant-producing, non-cause condition …

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.🔽Nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko hetu dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dve 🔽na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati

original: hetupaccayā. Nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipākadhammadhammo
analyzed: hetu paccayā na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ
translated: Conditioned by causes. A resultant-resultant and a non-resultant-resultant idea …🔽🔽A resultant-resultant and a non-resultant-non-resultant idea …

original: hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.🔽Navipākaṁ nahetuñca nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca vipākadhammadhammo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Navipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuñca nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve  na vipākam na hetuñca na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With cause as condition. A resultant and a non-resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause … (as in § 1, above) … two.🔽A non-resultant and a non-resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause … (as in § 1, above) … one.🔽A resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause and a non-resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause … (as in § 1, above) … one.

original: Navipākaṁ nahetuñca navipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko hetu dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Navipākaṁ nahetuñca navipākadhammadhammaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ
analyzed: na vipākam na hetum ca na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ hetu dhammo  uppajjati hetu paccayā na vipākam na hetuñca na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca dhamma
translated: A non-resultant and a resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause … (as in § 1, above) … one.

original: paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: A non-resultant and a non-resultant-by-nature state that is not a root-cause … (as in § 1, above) … two. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekādasa, ārammaṇe ekādasa, adhipatiyā nava …pe… purejāte nava, āsevane cha
analyzed: hetuyā ekādasa ārammaṇe ekādasa adhipatiyā nava pe purejāte nava āsevane cha
translated: With respect to cause there are eleven, with respect to object there are eleven, with respect to predominance there are nine … with respect to prenascence there are nine, with respect to repetition there are six …

analyzed: pe vipāke pañca pe avigate ekādasa
translated: … with respect to kamma there are five … with respect to nutriment there are five … with respect to faculty there are five … with respect to jhāna there are five … with respect to path there are five … with respect to association there are five … with respect to dissociation there are eleven … with respect to presence there are eleven … with respect to absence there are nine … with respect to non-disappearance there are eleven.

original: Navipākaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na vipākam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-resultant, multiple-cause dhammas as condition, a resultant-law-of-nature dhamma and a non-cause dhamma arise, by way of condition being a cause.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… aññamaññe cuddasa …pe… vipāke🔽nava …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe nava pe aññamaññe cuddasa pe vipāke 🔽nava pe avigate aṭṭhārasa
translated: (In brief) … with respect to cause there are eighteen, with respect to object there are nine … with respect to mutuality there are fourteen … with respect to result there are nine … with respect to non-disappearance there are eighteen.
